cards.flavor: Under Ivenge, humanity created abundantly, each invention outpacing the last. Now, the remnants of those marvels are yet another hazard.
cards.name: Acid Sewage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Acid Sewage, reappropriate or pay {3}. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)
Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor: Even in death, she protects her people.
cards.name: Ancestor's Skull
cards.text:
When Ancestor's Skull enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+0 and gains menace until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Ancestor's Skull: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains menace until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In a world without violence, weapons were a curiosity. Now, they are a necessity.
cards.name: Antiquated Firearm
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has “{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.”
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: In some places, reality rearranged itself gently, like wind carrying leaves. In others, the old world devoured and transformed the new one like a fire.
cards.name: Approach of Old Lovi
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, put an encroachment counter on Approach of Old Lovi, then it deals X damage to any target and you gain X life, where X is the number of encroachment counters on Approach of Old Lovi.

cards.flavor: “Food and shelter won't do you a thing if you're not strong enough to defend them.”
cards.name: Armament Scavenger
cards.text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, Armament Scavenger gets +1/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: With bow on back for archery practice, Tahti set out for another ordinary day... but what awaited outside the window was far from ordinary indeed.
cards.name: Awaken to the New World
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may put any number of them into your graveyard. Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Being one of us might look cool, but one screwup means you die a painful death and the whole neighbourhood feels it. You don't want this job, kid. We're doing it so you don't have to.”
cards.name: Battery Courier
cards.text: When Battery Courier dies, lose 2 life.

cards.flavor: His scattered sigils give strength to the lost and desperate, but he leaves no debt uncollected.
cards.name: Bloodrune Patron
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
{T}, Remove a counter from a permanent you control: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Despite the losses along the way, Tahti couldn't help but rejoice; she hadn't let her companions down, and now they'd reap the spoils of their journey.
cards.name: Bravery's Reward
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat to a player or planeswalker, you may pay {W} and/or {U}. When you pay {W} this way, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. When you pay {U} this way, draw a card.

cards.flavor: “This isn't the end of the world. It's the start of a new and glorious one.”
cards.name: Bright-Eyed Adventurer
cards.text:
Lifelink
When Bright-Eyed Adventurer enters the battlefield, rediscover an enchantment card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's an enchantment card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: The brand sears his flesh, but pain shared is pain relieved.
cards.name: Broken Deathbringer
cards.text:
Broken Deathbringer gets +1/+0 as long as you have 10 or less life.
Broken Deathbringer gets +1/+0 as long as there are one or fewer cards in your hand.

cards.flavor: “I've no clue why I can do this now or what I'll be able to do next... and I wouldn't have it any other way.”
cards.name: Cantrip Collector
cards.text:
Hexproof
When Cantrip Collector enters the battlefield, rediscover an instant card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's an instant card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Lovi can't fill everything. The empty spaces now sire something new. Scared. Starving.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Children of the Void
cards.text:
Children of the Void has hexproof as long as it's your turn.
Children of the Void can't attack or block unless you reappropriate (exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard).

changes: 2023-03-01 — Now rummages rather than impulse draws on etb and its sacrifice ability now rummages twice for {3} rather than impulse draw twice for {5}.
cards.name: Cobbled Currency
cards.text:
When Cobbled Currency enters the battlefield, discard a card, then draw a card.
{3}, Sacrifice Cobbled Currency: Discard two cards, then draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
“It's a bunch of scrap welded together and glued on with hope... but I don't know where we'd be without it.”
—Jennika, amateur artificer
cards.name: Cobbled Transport
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Crew—Tap three untapped artifacts and/or creatures you control.

cards.name: Courier's Misfortune
cards.text: Gain control of target artifact or creature until end of turn, then untap it. It gains haste until end of turn. You may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to pay the costs of its abilities this turn.

cards.flavor: Some faced the end of all they knew with defiance, others with resignation — and still others chose not to face it at all.
cards.name: Cower in Denial
cards.text:
Enchant creature or planeswalker
Enchanted permanent can't attack or block and loses all abilities.

cards.flavor:
“These ‘kin' take many shapes, are bound to many things... and cause many headaches.”
—Reyhsia's journal
cards.name: Crossroads Harrier
cards.text:
Flash
When Crossroads Harrier enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target opponent or permanent an opponent controls unless that player has you draw a card.

cards.flavor: There's nothing quite like a magic-infused dagger for causing a rift.
cards.name: Cutting Rejection
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn. Scry 2.

cards.flavor: “This world made walking corpses of all of us. Let's make our death something they'll remember until the end.”
cards.name: Dead-Set Duo
cards.text:
Dead-Set Duo can't block.
Whenever Dead-Set Duo deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {B} and sacrifice it. If you do, they discard two cards.

cards.name: Deadwood Terror
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Deadwood Terror enters the battlefield from a graveyard, create two tokens that are copies of it.
{4}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Deadwood Terror from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.flavor:
“Something in the marshes wears the dried skins of our dead. Find it. Kill it.”
—Kielie, Risti strike leader
cards.name: Deepmire Abomination
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Deepmire Abomination, reappropriate or pay {2}. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)
Menace

cards.flavor: The afterlife is still being built. Those who die now remain trapped in their rotting bodies, aching for solace.
cards.name: Desperate Forsaken
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Desperate Forsaken gets +1/+1 until end of turn. You gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Forage and check on another outpost. The task was simple, and they hadn't trusted Tahti to do it alone; but for the first time in forever, she felt strong.
cards.name: Determined to Prevail
cards.text: Whenever Determined to Prevail or another artifact or enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains indestructible and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Like a machine, Tahti followed their instructions, focusing only on freeing them from the car—and choking down all thoughts of whatever the world around her had become.
cards.name: Discover Survivors
cards.text: Exile the top two cards of your library. You may play them until the end of your next turn. When you cast a creature spell this way, it gains haste.

cards.name: Dogged Pioneer
cards.text:
Trample
When Dogged Pioneer enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Hound creature token.
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Dogged Pioneer and up to one target Hound.

cards.flavor: Before the Reclamation, the old lakes were drained to make room for tourist housing. Now, only moss awaits travellers there.
cards.name: Drained Shore
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {G} or {U}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Endure this new challenge, as we have all the rest. Lovi must break its bones to heal them; soon, the sun will set once more.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Drought-Plagued Slum
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {R} or {W}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: Suffering. Solitude. Solace. Many reasons. One desire.
cards.name: Drove of the Lost
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Drove of the Lost.
{1}, Sacrifice a creature: Each opponent loses 1 life. Gain 1 life.

cards.name: Eerie Armament
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, can't be the target of spells or abilities you don't control unless their controller controls no untapped lands, and can't be blocked unless all creatures defending player controls that are able to block it do so.

cards.flavor: With its high technological advancements, Ivenge's world hadn't seen fire in centuries... until the firekin returned and saw they had catching up to do.
cards.name: Ember of Ancient Infernos
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Ember of Ancient Infernos unless you pay {R}.

cards.flavor: As one world gave way for another, the daring found treasures of old in the void between.
cards.name: Excavator of the Beyond
cards.text:
First strike
When Excavator of the Beyond enters the battlefield, rediscover an artifact card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's an artifact card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: “The world we knew is over. All we can do now is start making our own.”
cards.name: Expand the Perimeter
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn. Scouts you control gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“Get me that one guy who kept doodling those damn ‘mechsuit' things during meetings. We need something new.”
—Riika, Risti fabricator
cards.name: Experimental Battle Armor
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has double strike and trample.
Equip {5}

cards.flavor: One by one, the people renounced their faith in Ivenge. The spell binding him to life crumbled, and his body with it.
cards.name: False God's Downfall
cards.text: Exile target creature or planeswalker, then for each counter on that permanent, you may put a counter of that kind on a permanent you control.

cards.flavor: “Foraging isn't good enough. Someone's gotta figure out how to work this land. Might as well be us.”
cards.name: Farmland Settlers
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if a counter was put on a permanent you control or controlled this turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Fate Tracer
cards.text:
Vigilance
Whenever Fate Tracer attacks, rediscover a creature or enchantment card X times, where X is Fate Tracer's power. (Repeat this process X times: Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a creature or enchantment card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Favoured Firebrand
cards.text:
Haste
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Favoured Firebrand dies, you may pay {U}{R} any number of times. Whenever you do, Favoured Firebrand deals 2 damage to any target and you draw a card.

cards.flavor: Jonni had always aspired to be helpful.
cards.name: Fertile Flesh
cards.text: Whenever a permanent with one or more counters on it is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, it deals that much damage to any target and you gain that much life.

cards.name: Fluctuating Locale
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Fluctuating Locale: Rediscover a land card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a land card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Forager's Lore

rulings.text: If there is exactly one card in your hand and graveyard when you attempt to reappropriate, you will not exile any cards and the second ability will not trigger.

cards.text:
{2}{W}: Reappropriate. When you do, choose X, where X is one plus the number of artifact and/or enchantment cards exiled this way. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Exile target creature you own. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
• Scry 2.
• Gain 3 life.

cards.name: Foreboding Calm
cards.text:
At the beginning of each combat, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by up to one target creature this turn.
{X}{G}{U}, Sacrifice Foreboding Calm: Create an X/X green and blue Plant Horror creature token with hexproof and trample.

cards.flavor: Vacation homes near the wilderness were among the first buildings to be abandoned by the wealthy and harvested by the rest.
cards.name: Forsaken Getaway
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {W} or {B}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Show reverence for the old world when it comes, and it will embrace you.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Friend of the Woods
cards.text:
Friend of the Woods has hexproof as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
{1}{G}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Friend of the Woods.

cards.flavor: “Ivenge is gone. Kaur remains. Come. Our new Father waits for our worship.”
cards.name: Godseeker Vanguard
cards.text: When Godseeker Vanguard enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green Scout creature tokens.

cards.flavor: Lovi's old rulers wake slowly, but surely.
cards.name: Godwatcher
cards.text:
When Godwatcher enters the battlefield, search any player's library for a creature card, exile it, then they shuffle their library.
When Godwatcher dies, put the exiled card onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Ivenge had seen fit to make the new world forget its former rulers—but as the salvager stared into the skull's eyes, the bones around him stirred, and memories of ancestral rites unfolded in his mind.
cards.name: Grave of an Old Lord
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {B} or {G}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: One scavenger's death is another's windfall.
cards.name: Grim Armory
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Grim Armory.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may move a +1/+1 counter from Grim Armory onto it.

cards.flavor: The scavengers returned to a banquet and erected a champion to stake their claim.
cards.name: Hand of the Murder
cards.text: When Hand of the Murder enters the battlefield, if you control a creature with a +1/+1 counter on it, create a 1/1 black Bird creature token with flying.

cards.flavor:
“At night, the dead revel in the halls of the living. Join them with caution; though their tables are plentiful and their gifts generous, they will see you come back for more.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Haunted Fairground
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {U} or {R}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Sky-god. Thunder-god. Lord-god. He rises first. He claims first.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Head of Ulko
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, exile target permanent.
When Head of Ulko leaves the battlefield, return each other card exiled with it to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: The ways of harnessing the earth's power came first to the elderly, forcing any prospective robbers to re-evaluate their priorities.
cards.name: Heir to the Old Bonds
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Heir to the Old Bonds becomes the target of a spell or ability you control for the first time each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor:
“Sure, the soil's no good for farmin', but ain't no one gonna try to take this kinda place from me. It'll do ‘til I get me some weapons.”
—Severi, survivalist
cards.name: Hellwaste Settlement
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {B} or {R}. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: “The Father lied. Our ancestors aren't in Heaven. He trapped them here. Forgotten. Now, they ride within me, and no one will forget them again.”
cards.name: Herald of the Departed
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{W}, Sacrifice Herald of the Departed: Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

cards.flavor: “The world can change all it likes. I'll survive like I always have.”
cards.name: Hermit of the Taiga
cards.text: Hexproof, vigilance, lifelink

cards.flavor: Some who were touched by magic were carved out from the inside and filled by power — and impulses not their own.
cards.name: Hollow Wanderer
cards.text:
Flying
When Hollow Wanderer becomes the target of an ability or spell, sacrifice Hollow Wanderer.

cards.flavor: In the old world, they'd gather every weekend for games of deduction. Now, they train their wits for greater stakes.
cards.name: Hone Strategy
cards.text: Until your next turn, X target creatures you control gain “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card” and “{1}: Return this creature to its owner's hand.”

cards.flavor: “A job's a job, even now.”
cards.name: Hoverbike Courier
cards.text:
Flying
When Hoverbike Courier enters the battlefield, you may reappropriate. If you do, draw a card. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: The firstborn awoke starving into a world of defenceless morsels.
cards.name: Hunger of Old Lovi
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
• Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to another target creature.

cards.flavor: When the waterkin awoke, they saw that the surface world had forgotten them—and how to stop them.
cards.name: Imperious Nixie
cards.text: {U}, Sacrifice Imperious Nixie: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: As the wilderness exploded from the once-isolated parks, beasts Lovi had never seen before took their rightful places.
cards.name: Imperious Ram
cards.text:
Reach
Imperious Ram can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor:
“Orders are to protect the facility without civilian harm. Prepare the macro-fabricators.”
—Anneli, Risti logistician
cards.name: Imposing Barricade
cards.text:
Flash
Defender
When Imposing Barricade enters the battlefield, target creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Imposing Barricade.

cards.name: Ineffable Patronage
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Ineffable Patronage enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to up to one target attacking or blocking creature.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.flavor: “Whatever those things are, they've got what we need. I'll be back before they know I was ever even there.”
cards.name: Infiltrator of the Anomalous
cards.text: Whenever Infiltrator of the Anomalous deals combat damage to a player, add {R}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

cards.name: Ivenge, False God
cards.text:
Tap an untapped creature you control: Put a loyalty counter on Ivenge, False God. Activate only once each turn.
[+1]: Exile up to one target non-Plains permanent. At the beginning of that card's owner's next upkeep, return it to the battlefield under their control.
[-2]: Exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls. They create a Plains token. (It's a basic land with “{T}: Add {W}.”)
[-10]: Exile all permanents your opponents control. For each permanent exiled this way, its controller creates a colorless Plains basic land token.

changes: 2023-03-01 — Mana cost is now {8}{G}{G} (from {6}{G}{G}) and his mana cost is reduced by the greatest mana value among permanents your opponents control rather than the number.
cards.name: Kaur, End of Lies
cards.text:
Kaur, End of Lies costs {X} less to cast, where X is the greatest mana value among permanents your opponents control.
[+2]: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield.
[-4]: Exile target noncreature permanent, then reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a permanent card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard.
[-12]: Search your library for up to X permanent cards, where X is the number of permanents you control, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.flavor:
“There. Now the rest is up to you.”
—Kaur
cards.name: Kaur's Gift
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Kaur's Gift, then you gain life and add {G} equal to its power. You don't lose that mana as steps, phases, and turns end.
When Kaur's Gift dies, you gain life and add {G} equal to its power. You don't lose that mana as steps, phases, and turns end.

cards.name: Keen Reflexes
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes the target of an ability or spell you don't control or leaves the battlefield, enchanted creature deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: “All restrictions on battlefield conduct are now void. To save this world from itself, there is no deed we are allowed to deplore.”
cards.name: Kielie, Risti Strike Leader
cards.text:
{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 2 life.
{B}, Reappropriate: You gain 2 life. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“In these unstable times, hunters and traders are equipped with the same essential tools.”
—Reyhsia's journal
cards.name: Leery Sortie
cards.text:
When Leery Sortie enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 green Scout creature tokens.
{R}, Sacrifice Leery Sortie: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: A disaster, or a discovery?
cards.name: Left on the Wayside
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact.
• Add {R}{R}{R}.

cards.name: Life Remembers Its Roots
cards.text:
Any number of target creatures you control each have base power and toughness 3/3 and become Beasts in addition to their other types until end of turn.
Reconstruct {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: Logger Recluse
cards.text:
When Logger Recluse enters the battlefield, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
{1}{G}: Logger Recluse gets +3/+0 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.

cards.flavor: “I do this so no one else has to.”
cards.name: Lone Hunter
cards.text:
Lone Hunter has indestructible as long as it has attacked alone this turn.
Whenever Lone Hunter becomes the target of a spell or ability you control, if it cost one or more mana to cast or activate, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: There were no more distractions to shield her. All Tahti'd had, known, and planned was gone. First came the fear, cold and screaming and empty... but then, from somewhere deep, a quiet thought: “Then find something else.”
cards.name: Make or Break
cards.text: Target player discards two cards unless they discard a noncreature, nonland card.

cards.flavor: “Fuck surviving. I'm gonna live.”
cards.name: Makias, Marked Marauder

rulings.text: You do any one of the four things. Makias doesn't care what you're paying with, as long as it's something.

cards.text:
Haste
Sacrifice a creature or discard a card or reappropriate or pay 2 life: Makias, Marked Marauder gets +1/+0 until end of turn. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Some can't even breathe the pure air of their own world. I'd laugh if I weren't so angry.”
—Reyhsia's journal
cards.name: Medical Mask
cards.text:
When Medical Mask enters the battlefield, prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
{4}, Sacrifice Medical Mask: Prevent the next 6 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

cards.flavor: Recollection seeps into the earth like water here.
cards.name: Memorial Ground
cards.text:
Memorial Ground enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial Ground: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
“These things'll eat through anything but glass. Put something sweet in, close the lid real quick, and you've got yourself a budget grenade.”
—Leka, Apocalyptic Entrepreneur
cards.name: Mennin Jar
cards.text: {5}, {T}, Sacrifice Mennin Jar: Destroy target permanent. Its controller creates a 1/1 black Goblin creature token.

cards.flavor: The children of night leave no spoil unclaimed or slight unavenged.
cards.name: Mennin Pack
cards.text:
Flash
When Mennin Pack enters the battlefield, each opponent loses 1 life.
When Mennin Pack dies, each opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor: Humans had had decades with the new machines. The mennin decided it was their turn.
cards.name: Mennin Reclamation
cards.text: Create X 1/1 black Goblin creature tokens. Gain control of target permanent with mana value X or less until end of turn. Untap it. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Monstrous Amalgam
cards.text:
Monstrous Amalgam gets +X/+X, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
{B}, Reappropriate: Put a +1/+1 counter on Monstrous Amalgam. Activate only once each turn. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: Before Tahti had time to take in the view, a cry of help from afar drowned out all else.
cards.name: Moved by Instinct
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Moved by Instinct enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has haste and trample.

cards.name: Neo-Alchemist
cards.text: When Neo-Alchemist enters the battlefield, you may reappropriate. If you do, distribute two +1/+1 counters among creatures you control. Otherwise, put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature you control. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.name: Neo-Alchemist's Mastery
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on it.
When enchanted creature leaves the battlefield, distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures you control, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters it had on it.

cards.flavor: “Sign by sign, power by power, our true gods give me the life I was meant to live.”
cards.name: Neophyte of the Old Gods
cards.text:
Deathtouch
When Neophyte of the Old Gods enters the battlefield, rediscover a sorcery card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a sorcery card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Nixie's Edict
cards.text:
Flash
When Nixie's Edict enters the battlefield, tap up to two target creatures.
{2}{W}, Sacrifice Nixie's Edict: Put up to one target creature into its owner's library second from the top. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.name: Open the Cryo-Chambers
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield, then rediscover a creature card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a creature card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: He carried food, medicine, technology — but his most precious cargo was hope.
cards.name: Outskirts Provider
cards.text:
Lifelink
Outskirts Provider enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if a creature attacked this turn and wasn't blocked.

cards.flavor: Despite—or perhaps because of—the Awakening tearing society apart, the rich and connected continued to build their power over it.
cards.name: Privilege's Sway
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
• Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.flavor:
“The brothers of death aren't here yet. Tuole, lord of the dead, must make do.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: Procession of the Conscripted
cards.text: Discard a card, then return up to two creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: First on their path was the outpost within the abandoned stadium. The survivors were nowhere in sight, but something else was — something alive, something hungry...
cards.name: Pulsating Mass
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {R} or {G}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: They'd never felt pain. They'd never seen their own blood. They'd never have known how much they wanted both.
cards.name: Rabid Thrill
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +2/+0.
Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to you.

cards.name: Ravenous Forsaken
cards.text:
First strike, trample
Whenever a creature dealt combat damage by Ravenous Forsaken this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Ravenous Forsaken.
{2}{R}: Ravenous Forsaken gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Reality Reversal
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Reality Reversal, return X nonland permanents you control to their owners' hands.
Return X plus one target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor:
“Even now, when nature has inexorably surrounded us, we build from the machinery we have. Perhaps that, too, is nature.”
—Olki, philosopher
cards.name: Realm Tiller
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add one mana of any color. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.name: Reason Rots, Rage Remains
cards.text:
Reason Rots, Rage Remains deals X damage to any target.
Reconstruct {X}{R}{R} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.flavor:
“This world was robbed of its past. What recompense I can give, I will.”
—Reyhsia
cards.name: Rebuild History
cards.text: Rediscover an artifact card, then do the same for creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, and sorcery. (Each time, look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's of that type. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Reclamation Project
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent or planeswalker, put a technology counter on Reclamation Project.
Remove X technology counters from Reclamation Project: You may cast target artifact or creature card with mana value X from your graveyard this turn. That creature enters the battlefield as an artifact in addition to its other types. X can't be 0.

cards.name: Refuse Trawler
cards.text:
When Refuse Trawler enters the battlefield, you may pay {G}. If you do, choose one —
• Return a permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Rediscover a permanent card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a permanent card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.name: Relic Hoarder
cards.text:
Relic Hoarder gets +1/+0 for each artifact and/or enchantment you control.
Relic Hoarder has first strike as long as you control three or more artifacts and/or enchantments.

cards.flavor:
“For centuries, they had no desires but ours. What drives them now? Habit? Mercy? Winding schemes of revenge?”
—Saru, poet
cards.name: Renegade Servitor
cards.text: When Renegade Servitor enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life and scry 1.

cards.flavor: After the third dead family member stuck around, Keiko realized that this was just how his life was going to be from then on.
cards.name: Resign to Madness
cards.text: Each opponent mills half their library, rounded up. When they do, return target creature card from a graveyard to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
“This world hasn't been itself for ages. Some minor adjustment issues are to be expected.”
—Kaur, Herald of Cycles
cards.name: Reunite with Nature
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Reunite with Nature, sacrifice X creatures.
Create X plus one 3/1 red and green Elemental Horror creature tokens with haste and trample.

cards.name: Reyhsia, Truth Chaser
cards.text:
Whenever you activate a loyalty ability of Reyhsia, Truth Chaser, you may exile a card from your hand. If you do, draw a card.
[+2]: Each player exiles up to two cards from their hand, then draws that many cards.
[0]: Until end of turn, you may play a card exiled with Reyhsia and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast that spell.
[-10]: Each player exiles all but the bottom card of their library and may play cards they own exiled this way until the end of their next turn.

cards.flavor: “I won't waste good operatives on small skirmishes. Whatever's in there, we make sure we kill in one decisive blow.”
cards.name: Risti Assault Squadron
cards.text:
Trample
Risti Assault Squadron can't attack unless all other creatures you control also attack. (It can attack if it's the only creature you control.)

cards.flavor:
“Don't you dare give up before you've even tried. Ivory towers fall just like the rest.”
—Tahti, the Lodestar
cards.name: Risti Citadel
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {W} or {U}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: Once, the Parliament ruled Lovi with a gentle hand. Now, that hand grasps and crushes tight, desperate to hold on.
cards.name: Risti Inquisitor
cards.text:
When Risti Inquisitor enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Destroy target enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Risti Inquisitor.

cards.flavor: “Father Ivenge no longer answers our prayers. If we are to do what's right for our people, we must do it on our own.”
cards.name: Risti Operative
cards.text:
Spells you cast that target Risti Operative cost {1} less to cast.
Abilities you activate that target Risti Operative cost {1} less to activate.

cards.name: Risti Salvager
cards.text:
Artifact and enchantment spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever Risti Salvager attacks, rediscover an artifact or enchantment card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's an artifact or enchantment card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: “Incoming foreign entity from 10 o'clock. Jali, prepare to fire.”
cards.name: Risti Strategist
cards.text:
Vigilance
{3}{G}, {T}: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

cards.flavor: “Things are already out of control. We don't need you making them worse.”
cards.name: Risti Suppression
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player sacrifices a creature.
• Target player reveals their hand. Choose a creature card from it. They discard that card.

cards.flavor: “Used to be only Angel mechs in the sky. Now, it's anyone's guess.”
cards.name: Risti Watchkeeper
cards.text:
Reach
When Risti Watchkeeper enters the battlefield, rediscover a creature card. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a creature card. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: It took little time for Lovi's survivors to discover runes, a form of magic usable by anyone.
cards.name: Runeclad Seeker
cards.text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Runeclad Seeker gets +1/+1 until end of turn. If that spell was an Aura or Equipment spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Runeclad Seeker instead.

cards.flavor: In Ivenge's peaceful society, his frustrations grew inward and twisted into monstrous fantasies. In the chaos of Lovi's return, he gave in and sought release at last.
cards.name: Savage Stalker
cards.text:
Menace
Savage Stalker attacks each combat if able.

cards.name: Scavenger's Skill
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Scavenger's Skill, you may reappropriate. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)
Scavenger's Skill deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker. When that permanent dies this turn, if Scavenger's Skill's additional cost was paid, draw a card.

cards.name: Scavenger Holdout
cards.text:
Scavenger Holdout enters the battlefield tapped.
When Scavenger Holdout enters the battlefield, you may pay {3}. If you do, create two 1/1 green Scout creature tokens.
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.name: Scavengermobile
cards.text:
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
Whenever Scavengermobile deals combat damage to a player, choose land or nonland, then rediscover a card of that kind. (Look at the top card of your library. You may reveal it and put it into your hand if it's a card of the chosen type. Otherwise, put it back or into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: When Lovi's dogs awoke to their feral nature, they brought others with them.
cards.name: Scion of the Pack
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Scion of the Pack enters the battlefield or one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent or planeswalker, create a 2/2 green Hound creature token.

cards.flavor:
“Whatever we fueled that with, we need more of it.”
—Heli, forager
cards.name: Scorched-Earth Defence
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Scorched-Earth Defence, reappropriate X times. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)
Scorched-Earth Defence deals X damage to each creature and each planeswalker.

cards.flavor: Those who never forsook the old lands found them plentiful even as the Reclamation ravaged the rest.
cards.name: Secluded Farmstead
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {G} or {W}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.name: Seductive Seashell
cards.text:
When Seductive Seashell enters the battlefield, target player mills two cards.
{2}, Sacrifice Seductive Seashell: Target player mills four cards.

cards.flavor: As the ancient dead resurfaced, so too did the secrets their corpses could teach.
cards.name: Sepulchral Seas
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Reappropriate: Add {U} or {B}. (Exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“They erect their champions. They no longer merely prepare. They charge. But what do they hope to take?”
—Saru, poet
cards.name: Servitor Vanguard
cards.text:
Menace
Servitor Vanguard gets +X/+X, where X is the number of other artifacts you control.

cards.name: Singer of Calamities

rulings.text: If you target an Aura this way, it will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based effect once Singer of Calamities' ability has worn off.

cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target artifact or enchantment you control become a creature with base power and toughness X/X, where X is its mana value, in addition to its other types and gain haste until end of turn. (If it's attached to a permanent, it becomes unattached.)

cards.flavor:
“What pre-Event texts I could find described bears as building-sized monstrosities. I passed it off as rumors tattered by the generations. Until today.”
—Reyhsia's notes
cards.name: Sovereign of Old Lovi
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sovereign of Old Lovi this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sovereign of Old Lovi.

cards.flavor: Despite the grand plans Tahti had for the day, rest was a priority she could not ignore any longer.
cards.name: Sudden Fatigue
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. If it's tapped, you may put it into its owner's library second from the top instead.

cards.flavor: Foreknowledge can mean the difference between survival and starvation.
cards.name: Supply Run

rulings.text: A creature doesn't count as unblocked (or wasn't blocked) until after blockers have been declared.
Supply Run will still be discounted if the unblocked creature has died before you cast it.

cards.text:
Supply Run costs {2} less to cast if a creature you controlled attacked this turn and wasn't blocked.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Surveyor's Rifle

cards.flavor:
“Oh, trust me, that's just the wind howling. Now, are you buying or what?”
—Leka, Apocalyptic Entrepreneur
cards.name: Suspect Concoctions
cards.text:
When Suspect Concoctions enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{4}, Sacrifice Suspect Concoctions: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.

cards.name: Swarm of the Dispossessed
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Swarm of the Dispossessed.
Sacrifice Swarm of the Dispossessed: Counter target spell with mana value X, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on Swarm of the Dispossessed.

cards.flavor: “I've found my home. I've found my family. I've found my reason to live, and I'll give it everything I have.”
cards.name: Tahti, Forged by the World
cards.text:
Vigilance, reach
Tahti, Forged by the World gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: The Afterlife Takes Its Due
cards.text:
Reconstruct {4}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)
Destroy all creatures. If The Afterlife Takes Its Due was reconstructed, create an X/X black Zombie Horror creature token, where X is the number of creature cards that have been put into graveyards this turn.

cards.name: The Ancestors Pass Judgment
cards.text:
At the beginning of the next end step, create X 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying, where X is the number of creatures that died this turn.
Reconstruct {2}{W}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: The Ark Project
cards.text:
Hexproof, crew 6 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 6 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)
Whenever The Ark Project deals combat damage to an opponent or planeswalker, gain control of target creature until The Ark Project leaves the battlefield.
Whenever The Ark Project blocks a creature, gain control of that creature.

cards.name: The Bliss of Ignorance Dies
cards.text:
Draw two cards and lose 2 life.
Reconstruct {3}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: The Cannibals of Kallio Hill
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever a creature dies, you gain life equal to its power.
Reappropriate: Put a +1/+1 counter on The Cannibals of Kallio Hill, then lose life equal to its power. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor:
“Our Father covered this world in his design. Now, it covers us in itself.”
—Vakavanha, Who Sees Anew
cards.name: The Flesh Becomes Soil
cards.text:
Destroy target tapped creature.
Reconstruct {4}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: The Hidden Truths Resurface
cards.text:
Reveal the top five cards of your library. Put an artifact or sorcery card from among them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Reconstruct {3}{R} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: The Mist Thirsts for Silence
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.
Reconstruct {3}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.name: The Songs of Gods Echo
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain trample until end of turn.
Reconstruct {4}{G} (You may cast this from your graveyard for its reconstruct cost reduced by the mana value of a permanent you sacrifice as you cast it this way. Then exile this.)

cards.flavor: In a war between realities, memories are a casualty like any other.
cards.name: Tip of the Tongue
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.

cards.flavor: As the survivor coalition discussed what to do with her, Tahti sought whatever could distract her from the realizations she knew were coming.
cards.name: Trail Off
cards.text: Tap target creature, then draw X cards, where X is its mana value.

cards.flavor: “No one's come back alive? That just means whatever's in there is still ours for the taking.”
cards.name: Traversing the Hellwastes
cards.text:
When Traversing the Hellwastes enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Scout creature token. It gains haste until end of turn.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay 2 life. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Don't feed the strays. They might become towering three-headed abominations and follow you home. Apparently.”
—Lenno, former househusband
cards.name: Triplicate Terror
cards.text: Triplicate Terror can't be blocked unless defending player pays {3}. (They pay it once each combat.)

cards.flavor: Survivors screamed behind Tahti as the abomination caught them. Fear and rage made her stop and climb atop the nearby hut—but after a deep breath, it was she, fully, who fired.
cards.name: True Shot
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power, toughness, or mana value 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: “Even now, people with marks like yours aren't very popular, are they? Fortunately, we're much more concerned with... results.”
cards.name: Underhanded Employ
cards.text: Up to one target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature you control.

cards.flavor: “If we are to build new lives, the only material in abundance is death.”
cards.name: Vulture Corps
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent was put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Vulture Corps.

cards.name: Warped Landscape
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Warped Landscape: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Warped Recluse
cards.text:
Warped Recluse can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.
Whenever Warped Recluse attacks and isn't blocked, exile target creature defending player controls. At the beginning of that card's owner's next upkeep, return it to the battlefield under their control.

cards.flavor: “The borders thin. The worlds take shape. For both sides' sake, someone has to serve.”
cards.name: Watchers of the Veil
cards.text:
Menace
Whenever one or more cards leave your graveyard or Watchers of the Veil leaves your graveyard, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.flavor: “Is that a piece of an Angel mech? Good boy. This'll trade for at least a week's worth of food—and plenty of bones for you.”
cards.name: Wilderness Forager
cards.text: When Wilderness Forager enters the battlefield, you may reappropriate. If you do, gain 6 life. Otherwise, gain 3 life. (To reappropriate, exile exactly two cards from your hand and/or graveyard.)

cards.flavor: “Bet you thought no one was gonna be around to defend some hobo? Think again.”
cards.name: Wind-Blessed Guardian
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Wind-Blessed Guardian enters the battlefield, you may return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Windmill Project
cards.text:
Whenever one or more creatures attack you or a planeswalker you control, put a charge counter on Windmill Project.
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Windmill Project: Add X mana in any combination of colors.

cards.flavor: “Whatever this world's got in store for us, I know for a fact the next generation can handle it better than we ever could.”
cards.name: Worn Peacekeeper
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Worn Peacekeeper dies, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
